page.title: 14The Crown Inn
page.content: The Wilson's Pub on Walsh Street is called the 'Crown'. It was built about 100 years ago. The owner, Danny Ferguson, also owns the 'Spotted Cow' on Middleton Road and Greenacres Inn. The 'Crown' has an antiquated licence which was introduced in 1915 for the War Effort and has never been repealed since. The customers are locals who go for a drink and sometimes to play cards or dominoes. Occasionally one gets drunk at dinnertime or in the evening. In this pub they sell Wilson's old fashioned, traditional beers. All lagers are 'keg', which means they are filtered and chilled. They also sell spirits and fruit juices. Beneath the pub is a cellar where the barrels are stored. The landlord lives in an attic over the pub which was modernised for him in 1980.
